thread.title: Kenya: Funds Delay Sh60bn Kitale-Lodwar Road
thread.title_full: Kenya: Funds Delay Sh60bn Kitale-Lodwar Road

title: Kenya: Funds Delay Sh60bn Kitale-Lodwar Road
text:
Kenya: State Dismisses Reports on Nairobi Lockdown for Obama's Visit 
Kachapin said it will benefit North Rift counties, which are forming an economic bloc. 
"We know the tender for the section between Kitale and Kapenguria has been awarded and contractors will start work soon," he told journalists in Eldoret town on Tuesday. 
Four international lenders are expected to fund the road, but they are yet to commit. 
Last week, Infrastructure PS John Mosonik said the World Bank confirmed it will fund the last 80km towards the Kenya-South Sudan border. 
The government has asked the World Bank, the African Development Bank, the European Union and Japanese International Co-operation Agency for assistance. 
"This is a key road for us in the North Rift and we have asked the government to liaise with the donors so it is done as soon as possible," Kachapin said. 
Nanok said the counties in the region have invested billions of shillings in infrastructure, but delaying the highway will slow efforts to open up the region, known for banditry. 
Kachapin said he met Nanok and they have agreed on plans to improve infrastructure. Kenya
